intro: Echites sagrae, commonly known as the sacred echites, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apocynaceae. It is native to the Canary Islands and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant produces distinctive yellow-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and slightly hairy, contributing to its unique appearance. Echites sagrae is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to grow in well-drained, sunny conditions.
